name: Analyze Crypto Market with CoinGecko: Volatility Metrics & Investment Signals

user.name: ist00dent
user.bio: I‚Äôm a dedicated automation engineer passionate about no-code and low-code solutions. I design and implement robust n8n workflows‚Äîintegrating APIs, databases, and messaging‚Äîto eliminate manual tasks and accelerate delivery. Leveraging Python and C#, I build scalable, adaptable automations that empower teams to focus on high-value work.

description:
This n8n template lets you automatically pull market data for the cryptocurrencies from CoinGecko every hour, calculate custom volatility and market-health metrics, classify each coin‚Äôs price action into buy/sell/hold/neutral signals with risk ratings, and expose both individual analyses and a portfolio summary via a webhook. It‚Äôs perfect for crypto analysts, DeFi builders, or portfolio managers who want on-demand insights without writing a single line of backend code.

---

# üîß How it works
- Schedule Trigger fires every hour (or interval you choose).
- HTTP Request (CoinGecko) fetches the top 10 coins by market cap, including 24 h, 7 d, and 30 d price change percentages.
- Split In Batches ensures each coin is processed sequentially.
- Function (Calculate Market Metrics) computes:
  - A weighted volatility score
  - Market-cap-to-volume ratio
  - Price-to-ATH ratio
  - Composite market score

- IF & Switch nodes categorize each coin‚Äôs 24 h price action (up >5%, down >5%, high volatility, or stable) and append:
  - signal (BUY/SELL/HOLD/NEUTRAL)
  - riskRating (High/Medium/Low/Unknown)
  - recommendation & investmentStrategy guidance

- NoOp & Merge nodes consolidate each branch back into a single data stream.

- Function (Generate Portfolio Summary) aggregates all analyses into:
  - A Markdown portfolioSummary
  - Counts of buy/sell/hold/neutral signals
  - Risk distribution

- Webhook Response returns the full JSON payload with individual analyses and the summary for downstream consumers.

---

# üë§ Who is it for?
### This workflow is ideal for:

- Crypto researchers and analysts who need scheduled market insights

- DeFi and trading bot developers looking to automate signal generation

- Portfolio managers seeking a no-code overview of top assets

- Automation engineers exploring API integration and data enrichment


---

# üìë Data Structure
### When you trigger the webhook, you‚Äôll receive a JSON object containing:

- individualAnalyses: Array of { coin, symbol, currentPrice, priceChanges, marketMetrics, signal, riskRating, recommendation }

- portfolioSummary: Markdown report summarizing signals, risk distribution, and top opportunity

- marketSignals: Counts of each signal type

- riskDistribution: Counts of each risk rating

- timestamp: ISO string of analysis time

---

# ‚öôÔ∏è Setup Instructions
- Import: In n8n Editor ‚Üí click ‚ÄúImport from JSON‚Äù ‚Üí paste this workflow JSON.

- Configure Schedule: Double-click the Schedule Trigger ‚Üí set your desired interval (default: every hour).

- Webhook Path: Open the Webhook node ‚Üí choose a unique path (e.g., /crypto‚Äêanalysis) and ‚ÄúPOST‚Äù.

- Activate: Save and activate the workflow.

- Test:
  - Open the webhook url to other tab or use cURL
```bash
curl -X POST https://<your-n8n-host>/webhook/<path>
```

You‚Äôll get back a JSON payload with both portfolioSummary and individualAnalyses.

---

# üìù Tips
- Rate-Limit Handling: If CoinGecko returns 429, insert a Delay node (e.g., 500 ms) after the HTTP Request.
- Batch Size: Default is 1 coin at a time; you can bump it to parallelize.
- Customization: Tweak volatility weightings or add new metrics directly in the ‚ÄúCalculate Market Metrics‚Äù Function node.
- Extension: Swap CoinGecko for another API by updating the HTTP Request URL and field mappings.

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

string.name: priceAction
string.value: Strong upward momentum in the past 24 hours

string.name: signal
string.value: BUY

string.name: recommendation
string.value: Consider buying on continued strength above resistance levels. Set stop loss at recent support.

string.name: investmentStrategy
string.value: Momentum strategy with trailing stop loss. Consider dollar-cost averaging to manage volatility risk.

string.name: priceAction
string.value: Rapid price decline in the past 24 hours

string.name: signal
string.value: SELL

string.name: recommendation
string.value: Consider reducing exposure or implementing hedging strategies. Watch for oversold conditions.

string.name: investmentStrategy
string.value: Capital preservation is priority. Consider re-evaluation after price stabilization.

string.name: priceAction
string.value: High volatility with significant price swings

string.name: signal
string.value: HOLD

string.name: recommendation
string.value: High volatility indicates market uncertainty. Consider waiting for clearer signals before making major positions.

string.name: investmentStrategy
string.value: Range-trading strategy may be effective. Set both upper and lower limit orders.

string.name: priceAction
string.value: Relatively stable price action with minimal volatility

string.name: signal
string.value: NEUTRAL

string.name: recommendation
string.value: Market is consolidating. Watch for breakout signals in either direction.

string.name: investmentStrategy
string.value: Consider accumulating small positions or implementing a neutral options strategy.

string.name: riskRating
string.value: High Risk

string.name: investmentStrategy
string.value: ={{ $json.investmentStrategy }} Due to high risk profile, use strict position sizing (max 2-5% of portfolio).

string.name: riskRating
string.value: Medium Risk

string.name: investmentStrategy
string.value: ={{ $json.investmentStrategy }} Moderate risk profile suggests balanced position sizing (5-10% of portfolio).

string.name: riskRating
string.value: Low Risk

string.name: investmentStrategy
string.value: ={{ $json.investmentStrategy }} Lower risk profile allows for larger position sizing (10-15% of portfolio).

string.name: riskRating
string.value: Unknown Risk

string.name: investmentStrategy
